Tips.title: Non-Physical Needs
Tips.description: Used to express crucial non-tangible requirements, like skills or qualities.

Tips.title: Exaggeration Caution
Tips.description: Be cautious of its overuse as it can sometimes exaggerate importance.
Tips.example: A good internet connection is essential for online gaming.

Tips.title: Immediate Needs
Tips.description: Often used to stress the urgency or immediate importance of something.
Tips.example: Finding shelter is essential in a storm.

senses.de: Something basic that you cannot do without
senses.ex: Fruits and vegetables are essentials in a healthy diet.

Tips.title: Basic Requirements
Tips.description: Refers to the most fundamental needs in a situation or for a purpose.
Tips.example: We had only the essentials during the power outage.

Tips.title: Minimalism Emphasis
Tips.description: Commonly found in discussions about living with fewer, necessary things.
Tips.example: She packed the essentials for her minimalist trip.

senses.de: Relating to something's innate or primary qualities
senses.ex: The essential differences between capitalism and socialism

Tips.title: Underlying Qualities
Tips.description: Highlights fundamental characteristics that define something's nature.
Tips.example: Understanding the essentials of a culture helps in learning its language.

Tips.title: Academic Nuance
Tips.description: Used in academic contexts to discuss core principles or concepts.
Tips.example: Grasping the essentials of a theory is critical for research.

Tips.title: Not Always Obvious
Tips.description: Essential qualities may not be immediately visible but are still critical.
Tips.example: The essential principles of democracy are not always upheld.

senses.de: Used for describing oils that have a strong smell and are produced by plants or flowers
senses.ex: Lavender essential oil is very soothing.

Tips.title: Specific Use
Tips.description: In certain contexts, like biology, it describes specific substances with precise qualities.
Tips.example: She prefers using essential oils for natural healing.

Tips.title: Aroma Importance
Tips.description: The word 'essential' signifies fragrance or therapeutic properties in oils.
Tips.example: Peppermint oil is essential for aromatherapy sessions.

Basic.wordDefinition:
Basic refers to something that is fundamental or necessary to have a basic understanding of a subject or a skill.

For example, basic math skills or basic knowledge of a language.

Basic refers to something that is fundamental or necessary to have a foundation on something, while essential refers to something that is absolutely necessary or vital for something to happen or exist.

Crucial.wordDefinition:
The words crucial and essential have similar meanings but there is a subtle difference between the two.

Crucial means extremely important or necessary. It suggests that something is vital and without it, the outcome would be negative or disastrous.

For example, a doctor's timely intervention is crucial in saving a patient's life.

Overall, both words convey the importance of something, but crucial implies the necessity for something specific and integral, while essential emphasizes a significant role in a broader context.

Fundamental.wordDefinition:
Fundamental refers to something that is basic, foundational or underlying in nature. It describes the most basic principles or concepts on which something else is built upon.

For example, the fundamental principles of mathematics include addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.

Both words are similar in that they describe something important, but essential refers more to practical needs, while fundamental refers more to underlying concepts.

Important.wordDefinition:
Important means something that has a significant impact or value. For example, getting an education is important for future success.

Essential is about necessity, while important is about value. Both words are applicable in different situations, depending on the context.

Indispensable.wordDefinition:
Both essential and indispensable mean something that is extremely important and necessary.

However, essential typically refers to something that is necessary for the overall function or success of something, while indispensable refers to something that cannot be replaced and is absolutely necessary for the task at hand.

For example, clean water is essential for a healthy body, while a surgeon's steady hand is indispensable during a surgical operation.

Simply put, essential means something is necessary in general, while indispensable means something is critical for a specific task or situation.

Key.wordDefinition:
Key means important or central to something. It refers to something that plays a significant role in a process or outcome.

For example, time management is key to completing tasks efficiently.

Essential refers to something necessary, while key refers to something important or central to a process or outcome. Both words are applicable in different contexts depending on the situation.

Mandatory.wordDefinition:
Mandatory means something that is required by law or a rule and must be followed without exception. For example, wearing a seatbelt is mandatory when driving a car and must be followed by all passengers.

Essential is used in situations where something is important or necessary but may vary depending on the circumstances. Mandatory is used in situations where something is required by law or rules and must be followed without exception.

Necessary.wordDefinition:
Essential means something that is very important or crucial, that you cannot do without, it is something that is absolutely necessary.

Necessary means that something is required or needed to achieve or accomplish something, but it may not be as crucial as essential.

For example, water is essential for human survival, we cannot live without it. A car is necessary for people who need to travel long distances, but it is not essential, as people can still travel by other means such as walking, cycling, or taking public transportation.

In summary, something that is essential is extremely important or crucial, while something that is necessary is required or needed to accomplish a particular task or goal.

Requisite.wordDefinition:
Requisite means something that is required or needed for a particular purpose or task. It refers to something that is necessary to accomplish a certain goal or objective.

For example, to apply for a job, a requisite qualification may be a college degree or relevant work experience.

Essential is used when talking about the fundamental and indispensable aspects of something, whereas requisite is used when talking about the necessary things needed to achieve a specific goal or task.

Vital.wordDefinition:
The words essential and vital both refer to something that is extremely important, but there is a slight difference in their meaning.

Vital refers to something that is necessary to maintain life, health, or well-being. Vital things are important for the continuation of something or for its success.

For example, a healthy diet is vital for a person's well-being. This means that a healthy diet is necessary for a person to be healthy and happy.

So, anything that is important for the continuation of life or for overall success can be described as vital.

Essential refers to something that is absolutely required, while vital refers to something that is important for the continuation of life or for overall success.

quotes.Text: What I've discovered is that in art, as in music, there's a lot of truth-and then there's a lie. The artist is essentially creating his work to make this lie a truth, but he slides it in amongst all the others. The tiny little lie is the moment I live for, my moment. It's the moment that the audience falls in love.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Lady Gaga

quotes.Text: There are a lot of things you can do in space, and space essentially is unlimited resources. We are climbing over ourselves here looking for the next source of energy. The universe has an unlimited source of energy.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.Text: The world has not yet reached the point which, in my view, is an essential condition for the survival of our human species: access by all the peoples to the material resources of this planet.
quotes.Title: Statesman
quotes.Name: Fidel Castro

quotes.Text: Life is very difficult. One of the most ancient of religious ideas that emerges everywhere, I would say, is that life is essentially suffering.
quotes.Title: Canadian Psychologist
quotes.Name: Jordan Peterson

quotes.Text: It seems essential, in relationships and all tasks, that we concentrate only on what is most significant and important.
quotes.Title: Danish Philosopher
quotes.Name: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.Text: Essentially, I'm a small-part actor who's been lucky enough to play leading roles for most of his life.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Alec Guinness

quotes.Text: I'll never forget where I'm from. It's essential to remain humble and evolving.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Freida Pinto

quotes.Text: Essentially, pride is a 'my will' rather than 'thy will' approach to life.
quotes.Title: American Leader
quotes.Name: Ezra Taft Benson

quotes.Text: Why should it be essential to love rarely in order to love much?
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Albert Camus

quotes.Text: Music is essentially useless, as is life.
quotes.Title: Spanish Philosopher
quotes.Name: George Santayana
